Design for Panels with Tempietto with Minerva, Crowned by an Obelisk and Victory

label: Description
value: Each plate of the series has two vertical panels with modern grotesques, the basic structure composed of rocailles, upper center a compartment with a scene. On the tempietto the coat of arms of the Emperor.

Deux différents desseins de Comodes (Designs for Two Commodes) in Livre de Diferents Dessein de Comodes (Book of Designs for Commodes)

label: Description
value: Two drawings for commodes.  The top drawing depicts the cabinet as having an angelic mask in the center, at the top, surrounded by curving, vine-like designs.  On the upper corner of the first commode, there is a grotesque, diabolic head.  The second commode is similar, but without the mask or head and with a slightly varied pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Etching, engraving on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
